file_content.text: Captain Hardin is ready to deploy to Karagga's palace on Hutta--good luck!
Thank you for your valuable assistance!
Good luck!
Hello! I am RL-4, special envoy of the Chancellor's office. Please remain still for a brief identity scan.
Excellent! Your skill and discretion during the Dromund Kaas operation has qualified you for a special assignment. Please hold while I connect you to Supreme Chancellor Saresh.
It's always an honor to help defend the Republic.
Gladly.
You carried out a mission into the very heart of the Sith? Incredible.
That's quite an achievement.
You got to invade Dromund Kaas? General Garza's been holding out on me....
You hit the Imperial capital?
That's not where we're going this time, is it? I might need a bigger insurance policy.
Sounds dangerous.
Splendid! Your diplomatic achievements with the Rift Alliance have qualified you for a top secret operation. Please hold while I connect you to Supreme Chancellor Saresh.
You must have been quite successful for the Chancellor to select you personally.
You should be honored.
It's always good to win more allies for the Republic.
Of course.
"Diplomacy" isn't the first thing I think of when I hear "top secret operation."
Sounds unusual.
Sounds like the Republic is trying to make some embarrassing friends.
Secret diplomacy, huh?
Perfect. You are hereby ordered to postpone all operations and hold for an urgent assignment from Supreme Chancellor Saresh. I will connect you directly.
If this mission is so urgent, I'd be proud to lend a hand.
Let me help.
Hold for scan... complete. You are authorized to assist, Master Jedi! Establishing secure connection now.
This can't be the usual chain of command for new orders.
What's going on here?
Havoc Squad is always available for the Chancellor.
Understood.
Even droids give you orders? I thought you were supposed to be important?
You put up with this?
I am merely relaying the orders of the Chancellor.
Splendid. Your dismantling of Grand Admiral Kirill's "Voidwolf" operation has qualified you for a unique assignment. Please hold while I connect you to the Supreme Chancellor.
Sounds like you might become a hero yet, Captain.
That's quite an achievement.
Is it a common military practice to send freighter captains after grand admirals?
That sounds unusual.
Military policies are not in my programming.
I take it this is a naval operation, then?
Sounds like navy business.
I'd best allow the Chancellor to explain.
If I'd known I'd be speaking with the Chancellor, I'd have looked even better.
I should've dressed up.
Your experience has qualified you for a special, top secret assignment. Please hold while I connect you to Supreme Chancellor Saresh.
Interesting.
Secure link established.
Couldn't she have just called directly?
This seems very indirect.
The Chancellor is a public figure--contacting someone like you directly would be noticed. This situation requires maximum discretion.
I have places to be--let's keep this short.
Make it quick.
I assure you, there is no task more urgent.
Greetings. I'm glad I could catch you--we've got a dangerous situation developing with the Hutt Cartel, and I want our best people involved.
The Hutts have carried out a series of brutal invasions into neutral territories along our borders. Attacking Republic forces could be their next move.
We should intervene before the Hutts can do more harm.
These attacks must stop.
I agree. But we need to be judicious, or we might create the conflict we're hoping to avoid.
We should find out why the Hutts are suddenly striking out.
There must be an explanation.
I'm hoping you'll be able to do so.
We should hit the Hutts now, before they become a direct threat.
Time for a preemptive strike.
We can't afford to add another front to this war--not until we have more facts.
There must be something valuable in those territories--not much profit in attacking the Republic.
Hutts only move for credits.
Perhaps their goals have changed.
If the Hutts are becoming a threat, why are you hiding it?
Why all of the secrecy?
We don't know if they're a threat or not. We need to get the facts before we let this information out.
As you said, they haven't attacked Republic forces. Why the concern?
Sounds like paranoia to me.
I refuse to sit back and let a potential enemy ready themselves on our doorstep. We need to know what the Hutts are planning.
It's possible these invasions are just a few Hutts getting greedy, not an organized Cartel war plan. We need to find out.
Another Cartel fleet is heading into the neutral territories as we speak. I'm dispatching a warship to intercept and investigate their actions. You're going to oversee the mission.
We'll get to the bottom of this, Chancellor.
It'll be an honor.
How far are we allowed to go to get answers?
What if things get violent?
You have my full authorization--do whatever is necessary to find out the reason for these attacks.
What are you offering in return?
Make it worth my time.
I believe I've made it clear how important this operation is to the Republic. I will compensate accordingly.
You'll be working with Captain Hardin, from the Outrider. He and his crew have already been briefed--they launch as soon as you board.
With your help, the Republic can end this threat before it begins--and keep our strength focused on our true enemies. Good luck.
Travel safely, gentlebeings!
Greetings!
